command_option.name: exclusive
command_option.title: Starts the Job Scheduler for Exclusive Service

description.p: Requires use of a database - see .

More than one Job Scheduler with the same Scheduler-Id () and the same database can be started with -exclusive. In this case, then only one Job Scheduler will become active. It is only after this active Job Scheduler fails or is stopped (), that another Job Scheduler will become active and take over operation. The takeover takes approximately one minute.

Warning: All participating Job Schedulers must be started -exclusive or . When one Job Scheduler is started with and one without this setting, then two Job Schedulers will run simultaneously, which can lead to unexpected results.
See also .

command_option.name: backup
command_option.title: Starts a Job Scheduler as a Backup Scheduler

description.p: Only possible in combination with .

A backup Job Scheduler only takes over operation - it cannot start a new operation. This means that after
the backup Job Scheduler does not start, but waits for another Job Scheduler to start operation.
-backup is allocated its own service name when used together with and . This means that the backup Job Scheduler can be run on the same computer as the active Job Scheduler as its own service.
The name of the main log file contains the "_backup" suffix.
Only possible in combination with .
When more than one inactive backup Job Schedulers are available to replace a failed Job Scheduler, (), then operation is taken over by the Job Scheduler allocated the lowest value.

Note that it is possible for another Job Scheduler as that dictated by the highest backup-precedence to take over operation, should the backup Job Schedulers run on different computers and should the clocks of these computers not be synchronized,
The default value is 1, when is set, otherwise it is 0.
